Reviews.Title: “Very Group Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Doc L
Reviews.Content: Excellent breakfast ( a lot more substantial than others we've had) Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Very accommadating-- kept our group together, which is nice for the group and for others! Great location-- easy highway access-- 10 minutes to everywhere. I would strongly recommend this place to anyone bringing a team or other group to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid stay at hotel down the road”
Reviews.Author: aimee0722
Reviews.Content: We stayed two out of six nights. Chose hotel based on location and recomendation from travel agent. Hotel photos look nicer then in person. Hotel was dingy, cramped and breakfast was awful. They turned a hotel room into a café where there was not enough room to sit. So we had to grab what we could and take our kids to our room to eat on the beds, not great with little ones. Parking was tight. We fired our travel agent did a quick search on line and stayed the rest of our trip at the comfort inn off of hotel circle. Fantastic service, updated rooms, great breakfast and it was less money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: L S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, especially for the location and price. Pros: Great Location, Clean Rooms, Good Service, Friendly Staff. Cons: Breakfast room is small and can't seat all the people. The hot breakfast served could not keep up with the visitors so people were waiting on the hot breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Debb54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of july 2011, was very clean, breakfast was good, location was great for all san diego has to offer. Would definitely stay there again. Price was reasonable :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: rockstarrulz1
Reviews.Content: Last min one night trip.we checked in late and we still got to park in front of our room. The inn also let us bring our two dogs for a low fee. And unlike any other hotel would have put us in there worst room cause we had two small dogs with us the room we got was nice a king bed bunk beds. Nice flat screen tv fridge and microwave althought we didn't stay long we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “BW Mission Bay a decent place to stay..not just for families”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl M
Reviews.Content: Got a chance to try this place at a very, very good price. Must say I'm impressed. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are surprisingly quiet, a little old, but decent. Staff are great. Problems are solved very quickly, housekeeping is quick & efficient. Also for a"pet friendly" hotel this place is exceptional. Breakfast is included and it's a great deal. Not just bad coffee & stale donuts, they have something for everyone &IT'S GOOD!!! My only complaint is they should start the breakfast a little earlier for us early birds...7-10 is just a tad too late for some of us..try 6:30? I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Room was clean, beds& furn nice, but hotel building is run down and old”
Reviews.Author: Tucladyfun42
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 2 nights, out of three. Reason was we requested a non-smoking room top floor. We got that but it was actually right next to a smoking room and we could smell the smoke through the walls and people would smoke out on walkways in front of room doors. Also the toilet stunk, must be the sewer system they use is old. If people come in late to their room and are talking on the outer walkways you can hear them as if they were in your room. Woke me up several times. The building must have gone through an earthquake since the walkways and room floors had a wave to them, kind of made us nervous about the integrity of the building. The room was clean, and beds seemed new as did furniture. TV was LG flat-screen and nice. The breakfast was good, but the breakfast room was small- basically at the back end of one of the three buildings they converted two rooms into the breakfast area, and if you wanted water with your breakfast you had to go next door to workout room to get some. We also wanted to bring our sm 10lb non-shedding hypo-allergenic dog, but yet stay on top floor. We were told they do not let dogs on top floor so that guests that are allergic to dogs have rooms that have never had dogs in them. Well we paid for someone to watch our dog at home, and it turned out we noticed two rooms on the top floor that had large shedding dogs in them. When we pointed this out to them they told us, well if they sell out of rooms on their first two floors, then people with dogs who check in late can stay on top floor. I find this very unprofessional that they give preference to those just driving by and checking in versus us since we made our reservation a month in advance and was told twice absolutely no dogs allowed on top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Lock up your Stuff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Heather P
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for New Years for our annual Seaworld New Year Trip. I liked how close it was to Seaworld. Check in was quick, however, I booked my room online and when I got there, they said I was in a smoking room. That was changed right away and we were put in a non-smoking room. The room was clean when we got there and everything worked except some a lamp. The lighting in the room was dim, but I can deal with that. We went swimming in the heated pool and hot tub that evening. The pool was good temperature and overall the pool area was clean. Only one of the jets worked in the hot tub, but all I cared about was the soaking in the warm tub. They had a towel area at the pool area and it had towels every time we went to the pool. So we enjoyed the pool area. The first full day that we left the room, we can back to a missing cell phone. I called the front desk immediately. They said that they would check with housekeeping and get back with me in the morning. NO ONE called me in the morning. I had to call them. They told me that they have never had a stolen item reported....and that was the end of that conversation. I kept the DND sign on our door the rest of the vacation and did not have housekeeping come in the remaining 2 days of our trip. I did file an incident report when checking out. The breakfast was better than the usual free continental. They had waffles, donuts, cereal, coffee and juices. Along with fruit. They had a hot selection that was different each day. I do have to say to check the milk before you use it as my daughter got some bad milk and got sick on the last day. I will not stay here and will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, friendly & good location”
Reviews.Author: tamccann
Reviews.Content: My spouse and 2 teens (16 & 19) stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during the Thanksgiving holiday while in San Diego for the Nomads soccer tournament. We booked the family suite (King + bunk beds + sofa bed) which is oversized, well furnished and very spacious. Arrived in late afternoon to a polite greeting at check-in which was quick and efficient. Room was well-appointed with microwave, fridge, coffee maker, and flat screen TV with a small but very functional work desk with electrical outlets in a fixture on the top of the desk so I didn't have to crawl beneath it to plug in laptop, phone chargers, or iPod. All the beds were reasonably comfortable as were the pillows. Due to the soccer game schedule, we did not have time to sample the free continental breakfast. Plenty of free parking between the "courtyard" lot surrounding the pool/spa and the overflow spaces next to the hotel. Location was just off I-5 and within walking distance (across freeway overpass) to Mission Bay Park. Again, due to soccer schedule we needed a late checkout and the front desk person was more than accommodating - even though I was not sure we would need the extra night I had reserved - I was allowed to keep the room until we found out if we would need to stay the extra night, which as it turned out, we did not need and were not charged for it. The housekeeping and maintenance staff were as friendly and efficient as the front desk and management folks. The only "negative" that I can recall was the flush toilet in the bathroom was loud, but apparently it wasn't loud enough to wake anyone during the night. I would not hesitate to stay at this property again and can recommend it to anyone looking for a clean, safe, accommodating place to stay in mid-San Diego that won't "blow up" the wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: BfromChicago
Reviews.Content: Just a standard, highway exit hotel...nothing more, nothing less. Hotel was clean,comfotable and came with a fridge and is near the beach. Plus, you are walking distance from Mission Bay park, which is an outstanding location for a morning jog. If you are traveling to San Diego on a budget, this place should be near the top of your list, as it is quite cheap when booked through an orbitz or similar travel site. Also, It is not in a bad neighborhood as some of the other reviews lead you to believe (I seriously doubt there is any real estate for sale in this area for under 500K) It is in the mission bay area, about a 5 minute drive from Mission / Pacific Beach....Again, you're not going to be wow'd by this hotel, but for a budget minded traveler, this is as much bang for your buck as you're gonna find in the San Diego area

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel - Clean, Safe and a great location”
Reviews.Author: traveler4149
Reviews.Content: Came to SD for a quickly planned college visit with my wife and two teenage boys. This hotel perfectly fit our requirements. Clean,safe, location, and cost. Staff was very friendly and professional. They have a standard continental breakfast, but the attention the staff devoted to keeping food stocked, coffee brewed, etc was noteworthy. There was enough space for us in the room and everything was well cleaned. Hopefully we'll be coming back to this city many times in the future...if so, this will be on our short list for dependable and affordable hotels.

Reviews.Title: “OK experience, expected a bit more”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best western Mission Bay for 3 nights in August. We arrived late, it was almost 11hPM. The front desk clerk, I think his name was Carlos, was very nice and polite but he was all alone. When I was in the lobby, he had 3 customers walk in and 2 phone calls he had to tend to while completing my check-in. Parking fills up quickly close to the rooms. The rooms were pretty clean but we had no bed spreads, only 2 sets of sheets and a blanket. The breakfast was good, they had 2 waffle machines but the room is way too small. 2 times out of 3, we had to take our breakfast to our room because there was no place to sit! The breakfast room is a room where they took the beds out, put some tiles in, got chairs and tables and voilÃ ! Our room was on the first floor, not far from the breakfast area... it's not pleasant to be waken up by the sound of the smoke alarm because someone forgot their waffle in the machine. It happened evey morning! The location is great, close to the attractions. There was a supermarket not too far. The pool was clean but not very big. They didn't have towels, you have to bring the ones in your room. I don't think I would stay here again, as I am sure I can get much better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Family Value”
Reviews.Author: sleepy2l
Reviews.Content: Clean but no frills motel with comfortable beds and small pool to occupy children. The breakfast was far more than we experienced at other area motels and the attendant kept everything filled up and clean. Convienient to most area attractions, Sea World, S.D.Zoo, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Decent, Clean Hotel near Fiesta Island”
Reviews.Author: m1a2a3
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year when we go to the Over The Line softball tournament that is held on Fiesta Island. Nothing special but it is an easy drive over to Fiesta Island without having to get on the Freeway. Good freeway access north and south for other outings, and a good value (nothing fancy) if all you are looking for is a decent place to sleep while you are on your San Diego vacation.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: millbug419
Reviews.Content: We could of picked any hotel and to bad it was this one!! As soon as we walked in our room it smelled BAD and then my daughter found someones THONG underwear behind the door. Don't think the room was even really cleaned?? The front desk was not much help either. The room they have for breakfast was way to small also!! There were ants in the bathroom!!! We will NEVER stay here again~!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly clean and comfortable, the best value in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: onthesand
Reviews.Content: We found this Best Western to be in the perfect spot for Sea World, Mission Bay, La Jolla, and all of San Diego really. The rooms were very clean and had all the stuff we needed...wireless internet, microwave oven, fridge, good A/C and cable TV. There was plenty of free parking too. The make-it-yourself waffles were terrific! (Be sure to use the non-stick spray before the batter goes in!) The hotel pool was where we spent a lot of our free time, a very pleasant spot. Housekeeping did a great job and the front desk was friendly and helpful. We took a short walk over the bridge to Mission Bay Park, right to the water â€“ a stunningly beautiful spot and surprisingly close to the hotel! Sea World is super close and La Jolla too. We found the rate was the best value for the area and we will definitely stay here again. If you are looking for location, cleanliness, low price for the area, and a great waffle, this is your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Getto- tel”
Reviews.Author: Avidgranddad
Reviews.Content: What dump, bed linen is two sheets with a blanket in between, there has to be a 1/4 inch gap around the door, ac dials "all broken" per maintenance man, so room is either ice cold or steamy hot. Area it is in is a dump, it is 6:00 am and the trash truck is emptying the bins. Well at least no shootings.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but a clean place to stay close to Sea World.”
Reviews.Author: carlinsmom
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a decent place to stay with the family, this place is great! Has a fridge, microwave, free wi-fi, and a lil coffee maker. It was clean and the beds are super comfy! You cant beat the location for Sea World and it's close to this awesome lil place "Bay Park Fish Co", you gotta go. It is nestled in a nice little neighborhood, not along a freeway or in any seedy neighborhood like some places we passed. The breakfast is pretty good, the waffles are really tasty. I would definately recommend this place for the money. We got it with a Sea World package at a discounted rate so it made it worth while.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Macknifetx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Sea World for our San Diego Vacation. While it a standard hotel, there is nothing special about it. The wireless connection got a poor signal in our room, but I was still able to connect. I was not worried about the room that much because we were only gong to be there at night after long days at the zoo and Sea World. My main requirement was that I felt safe at night and there was not a smell in the room. This hotel met that those requirements

Reviews.Title: “Manager hung up on me. WOW.”
Reviews.Author: kc_siebring
Reviews.Content: The stay was fine. The breakfast was fine. The management however... HORRIBLE! I stayed here with a friend 2 weeks ago and held the room under my credit card. When we arrived I told the front desk that my credit card was only holding the room, but that another credit card would pay for the room. They swiped the new credit card to authorize it. When I got home from my trip I realised they charged my credit card instead. I called them and was put through to 3 different ppl, finally had the chance to talk to a manager days later. After explaining it to him, he told me he would call me back. He never did. I left 2 msgs with my number. No contact was made or even attempted. I decided to phone him back and he told me I had to go through many hoops in order for the correct credit card to be charged. After telling me to take it up with my credit card company if I wasnt happy, he HUNG UP ON ME. WOW. Really great customer service. So disappointed in the service here. Your product can be average, but it's the SERVICE that counts and sticks with your customers. You want word of mouth advertising? You got it...I will never go here again, and I have friends who are going to San Diego soon for a wedding who were going to stay here. I have cautioned them to stay far away. Thanks for the average product and crappy service.

Reviews.Title: “Would rather have slept in my car”
Reviews.Author: Articfish
Reviews.Content: Usually, I have a lot of luck with Best Western's. Not with the Best Western Mission Bay. This place is a dump and it seem to me like more of an extended week type of place to stay. The front desk clerk was not very helpful as if he almost had better things to do and other things on his mind. The layout of the hotel is horrible as the pool and spa are in the middle of the parking. We were assigned to Room 218 which was a bad choice because it was right next to the elevator and ice machine. There was constant noise with the ice machine going, and kids running around making noise. The room was a dump, very, very small for a king size bed and outdated television, even no kleenex in the room! I would or rather paid another 20-40 for a better hotel. I will never ever stay here again and would never recommend this place to anyone. They should just burn it down and start over. It was just awful.

Reviews.Title: “Watch that first step!”
Reviews.Author: OCOzzie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mission Bay Inn on a one night trip to San Diego for a conference. The location is good, right off the freeway and across from beautiful Mission Bay. Staff was friendly and helpful Not far from all the attractions. Good value for the money. Breakfast included - free parking. The only caution I would advise is to watch out for the door thresholds from the room to the outside walkway- ours had a drop down of about 4 inches which could cause you to twist your ankle or jam up a knee if you didn't notice it. Some of the rooms had this problem, some didn't. I pointed this out to the manager and they were very attentive to the issue. I would stay there again, but would make sure my room had a level threshold.

Reviews.Title: “Skeptical at first, glad we stayed!”
Reviews.Author: dirtbikemom
Reviews.Content: With such mixed reviews, we decided to take a chance. Our room was clean and had plenty of space. Comforters could be updated to make the room more appealing and the blankets could have been thicker. Pool was heated and the hot tub was great! Very warm! :) Location is great! Easy access to attractions and freeway. Staff was WONDERFUL! Parking spaces are small but when you drive a full size truck, all parking spots are small! Overall, Great hotel, reasonably priced! We would recommend if your on a budget, this is your hotel! We will stay again. My son left his football in the room. When I called, they told me they would check with the weekend staff and give me a call back. I never received call back. : (

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Karizmatik
Reviews.Content: I had a great time. Staff were extremely professional, friendly, welcoming and helpful. Our room was very clean and spacious. I will definitely be going again! :o)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dragonboatSF_Ca
Reviews.Content: We used the Manager's special rate. Price was $79 including taxes per night. The rooms were clean & the beds was really comfortable. There was a race festival on the Mission Bay water, so there were many racers staying at this place. When we checked in, there was a large group checking in before us, however the desk people did an outstanding job handing this. We were all told breakfast will be ready at 7am each morning. We asked if they could open it at 6:30am instead because the racers had to be at the site at 7am. They accommodated us with the request and even had the breakfast area ready before that time. Everything was clean and the staff were friendly & helpful. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the other reviews!”
Reviews.Author: ClaraBel3
Reviews.Content: I brother-in-law was so upset when he read the reviews, he called his mother-in-law to ask if we could stay with them for the wedding. Well I wanted to see just was. I am so happy we went to check it out. It was very clean! There was new carpet, new mattresses, and new comporters and pillows. The room smelled very nice. Friendly front desk staff. In fact I arrived a few hours before check-in. I asked it I could check-in and she said yes. I told her I didn't care where the room was located as long as it was clean. She said no problem. It was very clean! Parking near the rooms is limited. Since we were at a wedding and came back late, we had to park in the front parking lot. But it wasn't bad. The pool was very clean. it was quiet. Now we didn't eat breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on it. But I would have not problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, good value and convenient”
Reviews.Author: ETx2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights for our short trip to Sea World and Legoland. We qualified for the government rate so it only cost us $99 a night. Good value for a hotel close to Sea World. The location was great, it was close to many local restaurants. The rooms were not fancy but clean and the air conditioning works pretty well. The outside pool and spa were a welcoming sight after a long day of walking. Just like many other Best Western hotels, breakfast is included. Nothing exciting but it saves us time so we can get to San World early without wasting time to have breakfast outside the hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “could have been cleaner”
Reviews.Author: louthemoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic, you get what you pay for. There's not much to do around the hotel if you don't have your own transport but if you do then it has easy access to shops, cinema and the freeway to get to the main attractions e.g. the zoo. The room itself was dark and grubby. We actually found a piece of half eaten toast next to our bed! The room obviously needed to be given a thorough clean including cleaning of the carpets. The good thing about the room was the beds were very firm, as were the pillows. The breakfast was average although we were almost pushed out of the door at 10am as the guy in charge cleaned all the tables and stacked the chairs up as we were still eating. Cleaning fluid was not a nice addition to our breakfast. Also check your credit card when you leave the hotel - my card was charged an extra $10 3 days after leaving the hotel. After we queried it we were told the extra charge was due to use "upgrading" to a non-smoking room even though i wasn't told about the extra charge at the time of checking in or out. The charge was refunded to my card though. If i was to visit San Diego again i probably wouldn't stay here again despite the good location.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty , Dirty , Dirty !”
Reviews.Author: persiahouston
Reviews.Content: On-line this hotel appeared to be a good value. Well you get what you pay for . This hotel was filthy . My daughters feet were black from waling on the carpet !!!!!!!!!!! Food left in mini fridge and microwave so gross we did not use it . We checked out after one night at the "ROACH MOTEL" and stayed at another hotel for the rest of our visit . This Best Western was a Worst Western and was more like a Motel 6 .

Reviews.Title: “Close to SeaWorld but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: MichelleBTucson
Reviews.Content: The rooms were fairly clean but the cleaning staff were rude and refused to even acknowledge your presence when passing them in the walkways. It appeared to be painful for one of the cleaning ladies to even respond to my child when she said "Hi" to her. The office staff on the other hand were friendly and helpul. It was noisey even in the later hours of the evening. The TV didn't work properly and needed to be replaced or at the very least given some maintainence. The only good thing this hotel really had going for it was the location. It was a short ride to SeaWorld.

Reviews.Title: “Worth returning 2”
Reviews.Author: Cmenapace
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights there,could have better internet service & it's on a hill,easily accesable to popular tourist attractions such as Sea World & the San Diego Zoo. We had wonderful house keepers & free ice machines near the elevator.Never found time to get in the pool or hot tub, but it's worth returning to.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better....keep looking elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: katydid0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of the Sea World visitor package and booked the room through Sea World. The rooms have cute little Orcas under the room number on the outside of the rooms, however there is nothing to warn you about the smell of raw sewage in the room we were in and the large cockroaches.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scvacationer1
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. We checked in, unloaded all our stuff. Then found out the water did not work at the hotel. The check in person did not tell us that the water was not working then lied and said it would be fix in 15 minutes. Four hours later, still no water. Had to pack up and move to new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel - Literally!!!”
Reviews.Author: onesweetcowgirl
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving with my family we noticed the garbage had not been cleaned out from the previous guests. No big deal, then there was a message on the phone which had been left for a previous guest, the maids did not erase this. It was a little annoying, who knows maybe they didn't even change the sheets. Anyhow, overall the room was filthy, the floors turned our white socks nearly black from how dirty they were. What takes the cake of this nasty motel was when I went to take a shower at 6 am, I opened the shower curtain to my dismay there were roaches! I captured two of them and put them in a glass of water to show the hotel. As I exited the bathroom I picked up my dirty clothes and found an even larger roach under them! EWW!! I was livid! I took the roaches in the Best Western cup to the front desk and we checked out immediatly. They made no attempts at appeasing me about how upset I was. They offered nothing for my horrible experience. I would highly recommend finding a different hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad..”
Reviews.Author: kobuzas
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only 2 nights to enjoy the beach. I think a bit expensive, but clean and perfect location, if you want stay on the beach. Gaslamp district only 10miles, Seaworld 5miles away..

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.”
Reviews.Author: James340
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on 8/27 to 8/28. One night only. This hotel was booked by another family member who also stayed in another room. We also had some cousins and one small child in another room. This hotel was chosen for the price and proximity to Sea World only. Rooms are small, bathroom even smaller. Couldn't find the deluxe breakfast, but did find day old muffins and some toast. Like I said it was for one night and spent all day Thursday and Friday at Sea World, so really only slept at this hotel so my rant is minimal. Have stayed at other hotels in the area but this one was cheapest so gave it a shot. If you need more room, or traveling with children, this hotel may feel claustrophobic. All in all, no major issues on our one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best weatern in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: at69Ravenna
Reviews.Content: I strong suggest this hotel for everybody who like to spend their holidays in San Diego beach. It's a good hotel on the beach and it's perfect for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but far from everything despite advertised closeness to beach”
Reviews.Author: Mkspangenberg
Reviews.Content: The good thing is that this hotel is very cheap compared to all else in the area and has handicapped accessible full walk in showers which are very hard to find on the cheap. You can not walk to the beach from this hotel despite the ads. You are off a freeway and busy main street. i could not even imaging wanting to walk to the beach. ( 3-4 miles to Mission and Pacific beach according to our GPS and drives)You could walk to the bay but that would be too far a walk with young children and bag and stuff. The room carpet is very dirty and something stank to high heaven in the room but that happens in musty places I guess. Hope the room did not have mold. We had the same dirty feet problem as the other reviewer stated. The beds were ok for the price. The breakfast room and staff is awful you can't get a seat. The food was typical continental bkfst fare so if you bring it back to your room it would be Ok. The office staff is nice. The bfst room worker was not very good. She could not refill the very small area adequately nor clean the tables. One very big disadvantage was how noisy the hotel is especially having a room near the bkst room. Everyone walks by talking very loud. I guess people don't teach their children it is rude and unacceptable to talk in hotel hallways. My Dad always pounded that into my head as a child. But laundry staff need to be quieter. So if you have a car and want cheap you will be ok here but I prefer closer to the beach. PS- the parking is a nightmare. Do they have fewer spaces then rooms I wonder? We could not find a spot one night and we were with a handicapped person.

Reviews.Title: “Not what expected!”
Reviews.Author: TexasLadyRider
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel with cheap, clean rooms and courteous staff, but I wouldn't stay there again. The location is great to Seaworld, but it certainly isn't easy to "walk" to the beach. The hotel is right off of I-5 and you have to cross over the interstate on an automobile bridge to get to the beach that is still blocks away....I wouldn't try this with small children. There is no place to eat within walking distance, you definately need a car. The continental breakfast is in a hotel room and there is not much to choose from except cereal and donuts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MTS4104
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 days. Everything was excellent! The service was always helpful. The location was great and right off the interstate. Everything in the room was kept nice and neat. The pool was excellent and well kept. The only downfall of this hotel was there was no complimentary breakfast but they do have serval restaurants in the area (Denny's was a couple blocks away). Everything about this hotel was great and we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach in Room”
Reviews.Author: PacoMom
Reviews.Content: The location is good for Sea World, and the prices are less than other hotels in the area. That said, this is not what I expected from my previous stays with Best Western hotels. Our room was next to the laundry room and the staff did laundry until 1o:30 pm despite a call to the desk. The hotel is very noisy, and it is not possible to sleep past 7 a.m. If you want to be out early I guess that is okay, but if you are tired and want to sleep in forget it. We were there 3 nights. The second night we found a HUGE cockroach in our room--my husband killed it and took it to the front desk and their attitude was so what. Two of our three nights people were talking loudly and drinking in the parking lot. Twice I had to ask people having loud cellphone conversations right outside my door to please be quiet--this was at midnight. The front desk or manager do not appear to pay any attention. The breakfast room is quite small, and people were waiting in line to get in for some coffee and donuts.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe, Reasonable Hotel, Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: StanQuentin
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Mission Bay is in one of the most beautiful spots on the Earth. It is convenient to dozens of attractions, close enough to get to both UCSD and San Diego State, and within walking distance to bus routes and several beaches - all without being in a busy, high traffic area. Parking was adequate, the rooms were clean and stocked. The staff is friendly and went above and beyond to help me find some hard to find publications from the area. The rooms were clean, the continental breakfast was more than just a bagel... it was an actual breakfast with several selections to choose from. And did I mention the price was very reasonable? Would definitely love to stay at the Best Western Mission Bay again, anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Good price but the carpet was surprisingly dirty!”
Reviews.Author: mamey
Reviews.Content: Best Westerns are generally good for families with young children, and this one provided a similar experience for my family. The front desk staff were courteous and the general appearance of the facility was just fine. The pool is located centrally, surrounded by the parking lot and then the actual rooms. Our room was clean upon arrival. My only complaints are that the bathroom was small and that probably contributed to the musty smell in it, which we determined to be from the shower curtain primarily. Still, the smell made us a bit nauseated and we left the fan on all night with the door closed. Additionally, after bathing my kids, I noticed that their feet quickly became filthy without leaving the room. We figured out that the dark navy carpet was quite dirty as all our feet were black upon inspection despite bathing! I guess you get what you pay for, and we got a great rate. Next time, I'll spend more money for a higher rated hotel. There's already too much to deal with when travelling with young kids that any added luxury (or at least something you don't have to think about) is nice! Otherwise, the internet worked, the room was quiet, and having the microwave and fridge were convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: vacancier955
Reviews.Content: An expensive hotel for the quality / service offered. Very dirty room, very bad and poor breakfast. The only advantage is that it's located very near to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value/Decent clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: AuntieAnn
Reviews.Content: Good Value at this hotel & Hotel was Clean. Parking lot is tight - very tight - if you have a big car - good luck parking it! Good Acess to the I-5. No elevator. Felt safe staying here.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: RTHolt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conviently located just off the I 5 so it is just minutes to most attractions. The room was clean and the service was good, It was a little noisy from traffic and the parking lot, they could use some new windows. Overall we had a great experience and this is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value, Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: MN_Loretto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Best Western in November, and found it to be better than some reviewers were saying. Yes, the hotel could use updating, in the carpet area especially. We had a 3rd floor room right by the elevator; was worried it would be noisy but it was very quiet. We did not have any problems with cleanliness; the staff did a good job in that area, and we were there for 4 nights. A rental car is a good idea for this location, since it is convenient to the freeway, but not much else. You could walk to Mission Bay park area by using the sidewalk on the bridge, but that's about the only place within walking distance. The breakfast was OK; typical continental menu and not a great deal of space (located in the space formerly a room). For the price, it was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: azgirl37
Reviews.Content: We just left San Diego, Best western Mission Bay, we were there 4 days and had a great time there. Our room was very clean, no bugs no smoking and no dirty floors as most have reported. The office staff was curtious and gave us what we needed. They told us it was minutes to Sea World and gave us a sheet that listed all the attractions and directions on how to get there. The nights were quite no loud neighbors. The parking is a little small around the hotel but they have a lot off to the side. But it is a ways to walk. Maybe we just caught them on a good weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Decent hotel . . . a little noisey and busy though.”
Reviews.Author: Pollito1
Reviews.Content: I made this reservation through Priceline for about $125.00 a night and stayed here for 5 nights. Watch out! Priceline refused to change this reservation despite my protest that that hotel was not in the area I orginally requested. . .which was La Jolla. Basically when you select the general vacinity you are interested in they can and do place you on the very outskirts of that area. All to say that I was not looking foward to staying at this location but I thought I would make the best of the situation to avoid a legal battle with Priceline ( I will NEVER use them again). I knew that the hotel was known for being a family location so I purposely called ahead of time and asked to be on the third floor. That was a great decision, except they placed my husband and I right by the elevator and right by the ice machine (room 318) so it was never quiet near our room after 7:00ish in the morning because everyone was getting ice and using the elevator. I came prepared though and brought earplugs and they actually really worked. The location was pretty good. We could ride our bikes right over to Mission Bay and enjoy the parks and water. It was only a 10-15 minute drive to La Jolla beaches and Sea World. The room was a decent size for the two of us and the bed was decent. I brought a lot of snacks and the refrigerator and microwave came in very handy. The breakfast they serve in the morning was average but plentiful. The service was fair; the ladies in the front were generally helpful and nice, however they would not accomodate our request to move from being next to the elevator because we were staying too many consecutive nights and they didn't have anything available. Who knows. I know they were pretty sold out. The last two days we were there room service tried to clean our rooms at 9:00 am, hello we are sleeping or just waking up! I also heard that the rooms smelled funny so I brought a Glade plug-in for the wall and it really helped. . .it smelled nice and sweet like I was at home. I guess on a scale from 1to 5 it was a 3.8 for me and a 3.5 for my husband. It's a step up from a Motel 6 but definitely a big step down from a Hilton or something like that. It would have been nicer if the grounds were a little cleaner (elevator is dirty), if it was more quiet but overall it was pretty good and satisfying. I don't know why some people have really bad experiences here unless maybe they are on the first floor and have to deal with car noise and kid noise but overall we had a good stay and were able to enjoy our vacation and were pretty close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty!”
Reviews.Author: oliverSeattle
Reviews.Content: A group of 22 basketball players and their families stayed here for a tournament. We were told that we would get a group rate of 159.00 for booking so many rooms. We noticed while being in the office 12 times to get our keys re-done that there were many who booked for this rate with a single room. The hotel was FILTHY, the non-smoking rooms had a smoke smell mixed with mildew and dirt, the carpets were so dirty that there was brown marks on our socks after stepping in a droplet of water then walking on the carpet, they ran out of towels numerous times. This is just a small token of the rooms, if you stay there you too will experience the the nastiness in its full splendor. I am still itching thinking about the rooms with the ants!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best $200 I've spent on a hotel room”
Reviews.Author: MrvnMrtn
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for a one-night stay for its proximity to Sea World. We checked in around 5 pm and were given room 101, which was directly behind the front office, across a dark, enclosed corridor. We found the A/C going full blast, probably in an attempt to clear out the mildewy air that smelled of stale cigarettes. The only window faced the aforementioned dark corridor, so the room was very gloomy. I requested a different room, but was told that there were no others available. "Really?" "No other rooms are available." So, given that we only had to sleep in the room for one night we gave in. Later, after the wife and kid were asleep, I sat in the front office sitting area to read for a bit and watched as at least four parties checked in, some for single nights, and another get their room changed due to noisy neighbors. ?!* Me: "I thought you said there were no rooms available?" Clerk: Munbo-jumbo about room assignments. Me: "Are you saying that rooms are assigned when we make the reservation?" Clerk: "Did you call the direct number to make the reservation?" Me: "No, I used your web site." Clerk: "Oh, that doesn't give you an option for a non-smoking room, and the room we gave you was the only smoking room we had left. You should have called this office directly after making your reservation." Me: "Huh?" Pros: It is one freeway exit from Sea World (10 minutes). They do have a continental breakfast. We didn't have any bugs or other issues that some of the other reviewers mentioned. Cons: If you want a non-smoking room, you apparently need to confirm that by calling the hotel directly (at least for this branch). The pool is in the middle of the complex and was very popular the weekend we were there, and the noise reverberates. It was almost 11 when the noise stopped, in spite of the posted closing time of 10. Don't get room 101 or 102, unless you're a bat (who smokes). I was also apparently misled by the clerk told me that they didn't have Wi-Fi when I asked, because the other reviewers complimented that feature.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, 2-star motel”
Reviews.Author: groovyvegan
Reviews.Content: To picture this Best Western, it's a 3-story "U" shape, with all rooms opening to the parking lot and tiny pool, and 2-person hottub. The tiny pool (and entire property) were teaming with children, as this hotel is only one freeway exit away from Sea World and inexpensive for San Diego at $150 a night (with AAA discount). The parking lot, BTW, was the tightest and most difficult we have ever seen for a hotel. Cars were wedged in so tightly, that in the morning when we left, someone was helping a Prius (!) back out without hitting other cars. Room 319 was one of only about 3 rooms containing a king-sized bed. (The others have 2 queens.) The room was averaged sized, and contained a small refrigerator, microwave, desk, and love seat. The bathroom had the floor space of a bathroom stall, with the sink outside. The accomodations were very basic, yet clean and comfortable like the old Motel 6 commerical claims. Unlike some other reviewers, we saw no bugs. For the most part, we found the motel to quiet down from the hours of 9 pm to about 7 am, although the ice machine outside our room sounded like a small avalanche. And there were some loud footsteps and luggage dragging outside in the middle of the night. My partner, who can never turn down a free meal, reports that the continental breakfast consisted mostly of cereal, watered down orange juice, unwatered down juices (apple and passion fruit), and packaged yogurt. On day 2, the orange juice machine wasn't working. The breakfast was crammed into a converted first-floor motel room, and when he finished breakfast at about 6:50 am, crowds of parents and children were waiting to get into the small space. If you're looking for a no-frills, kid- and pet-friendly motel that's inexpensive by San Diego standards, you might want to look into this motel. OTOH, I've stayed at many Best Westerns, and this motel is not as nice as any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel”
Reviews.Author: hce70
Reviews.Content: So many roaches! Room smelled like mildew. We didn't expect this from a nice area hotel. We booked through Getawaytoday and there a joke! They said they had to talk to the hotel manager to get a answer as if we would lie about something that serious. The manager came back and said they could not find a problem but sprayed like heck all over the area around our room and shut the drains. We took pictures and sent them to getawaytoday but it didn't help. I would not recommend this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, family and pet friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozdiverleslie
Reviews.Content: This is a good, clean family hotel that accepts pets and is reasonably priced. The only disadvantage is that there is no restaurant within walking distance. The staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before staying here....”
Reviews.Author: Rastagolf
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. It was was dissapointing experience. Negatives: Our room smelled like bug spray and had an infestation of ants. We asked to see another room, however, it smelled just the same. The room was large, but the carpet needed to be cleaned or replaced (it was fraying near the bathroom). The free breakfast was limited. The dining area is a converted hotel room, thus very small. The hotel is noisy at night. Not within walking distance of resturants. Positives: The microwave and samll fridge in the room! Also the free wireless internet was great. The hotel is close to the freeway. Free USA Today in the hotel office. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: chocs1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the most disappointing hotel I have ever stayed in. I arrived at the hotel after a long journey to discover this hotel was located on the side of the interstate. The hotel front desk told me that nothing was within walking distance - despite the advert on the website implying most attractions were. When asked how guests without a car manage I was assured the public transport system was easy to use. I was given an information sheet on the attractions and how to get there by bus etc... To get to the bus stop I had to cross a dangerous interstate. I was told the buses were every 15 mins and I needed to change twice to get to downtown san Diego (where I was recommended to visit). This was incorrect. In the daytime the buses were every 30 mins and I actually did not need to change at all. To make matters worse in the evening the buses were less infrequent - every hour- and none actually went near the hotel. I then spent an hour on the bus to be dropped no where near the hotel. I was nearly attacked and had to call the police for assistance. I then had to call 15 cab companies before one would come to my location to collect me. I am a stranger to San Diego and am a 26 year old single female. I had never been so scared in my entire life. Upon arriving to the hotel -after also requesting a quiet room, I heard the neighbor a few doors down having a party with 10 people in the room. I complained to the front desk as it was now 1230am and they said they couldnâ€™t hear anything and wouldnâ€™t investigate. I complained the next day to the general manager. All she offered me was 10% discount on my stay. My whole vacation has been ruined. I have been left witha horrid image of San Diego and actually cut my trip short by a day and checked out early.

Reviews.Title: “It's not like the Hilton @ Mission Bay, but it was almost half the cost!”
Reviews.Author: dcsjeeep
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and were very satisfied. We had a conference at the Hilton which costs twice as much. The Hilton might have been twice as nice, but if you are on a tight budget, the best western is just fine. The free continental breakfast was better than average and the employees were very friendly. We were on the top floor, and our neighbors complained because our two year old son was making too much noise. He wasn't crying, but he was running around in the room . This tells me that the floors and the walls are very thin. Tip: DO NOT order food from the businesses that slip flyers under the door. They are very expensive and the food is terrible. Also, there is a chinese food buffet up the street that is absolutely horendous. Stay away at all costs!! Keep driving up Clairmont Drive until you get to the mall at the top of the hill. There is a Chili's and an Outback steakhouse that is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Alright for a family on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Travelmom73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the advice of several people on the T.A. Forums and it wasn't that bad. It's not in a nice area really, but very convenient. I don't think it's worth what they charge (and we had the "Managers Special"), but otherwise not bad. The room we had was very dark and dreary, located behind the office, but it was nice for getting three kids in and out of parking lot. It was depressing to have it so dark, and the decor doesn't help, but you can't have everything. I was also annoyed to discover that while they say they have a laundry, there actually isn't one and it's a good drive away - you couldn't walk to it carrying any amount of laundry. The pool and hot tub area is small but my kids and hubby had no complaints. It would be nice if some parents of some teenagers would control their children so they don't run wild and act like hooligans, but that was no reflection on the motel. The staff at this motel were the best we encountered on our trip, and any requests were dealt with immediately and professionally. My biggest complaints were no laundry although advertised with one, and the price doesn't really make it a good value. The room we had needed some cosmetic maintenance but otherwise was comfortable. Very convenient to Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Quiete OK”
Reviews.Author: musli99
Reviews.Content: On our trip to san diego we spent a night in this hotel and were quite happy with the service. specially the location was great... next to the ocean and the walkway... heated pool and jacuzzy so that even by end of october and cooler temperatures we could enjoy a bath in the dark - lovely! rooms are specious and clean! the only point we were a bit disappointed was the rate - the staff just charged us the highest rate (as we had to find out afterwards) but I think that this is rather our mistake... it just feels a bit unfare.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: sadienbelle
Reviews.Content: My sons and I stayed one night here during a quick trip down to Sea World. The hotel room was clean and everything was in working order. The parking is cramped by the hotel but there is a large parking lot that is part of a shopping center right next door which we used without any incident. We did not have any problems with noise and the close proximity to SeaWorld let us take a break from there in the afternoon and then go back for fireworks. We also found some fast food nearby that was cheaper than SeaWorld for dinner. The only negative was the small room used for the breakfast. Fortunately all the guests were eating quickly so turnover at the tables was pretty constant.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks in location, but makes up for it in price”
Reviews.Author: MicheleNY
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in San Diego, in the beginning of July, with two of my friends. When we arrived at the hotel, it was very easy to see that it wasn't in the best of locations. It may be very close to Mission Bay and a few minutes drive from Sea World, but even the nearest place to eat, besides a Jack in the Box, is a few miles away. But the hotel itself was clean, the staff were friendly and helpful, and it was nice having a pool, even if it was in the middle of the parking lot! (tip-when everyone is heading to the beach, the zoo, and Sea World in the morning, head to the pool for a few hours. We were always the only ones out there enjoying the water in the morning instead of having to deal with the crowds at night.) Because it is a family hotel, if you plan on sleeping in mornings passed 7, get a room on the third floor and not by the stairways or elevator, which are heavy traffic areas. The complimentary breakfast is the same every day (cereal, muffins, fruit) but it saves time and money. And because the rooms are equipped with a refrigerator and a microwave, you can stock up on drinks and snacks to bring with you during the day or for downtime before going out at night. Also, grab the brochures from the lobby and 'dining area'. There are so many things to do in addition to Sea World, the Zoo, and the beach. They have information on parasailing, Old Town, jetskiing on Mission Bay, and dozens of other adventures. We had one of the best vacations, even if we did get ripped off by cab drivers. If you are traveling without a car, with a group of friends, or a couple, stay in Old Town. There's a nice Best Western there, and you are right near shops, restaurants, and nightlife. (For real, authenitic Mexican food, go to El Agave Tequileria.) Plus there are trams that run out of Old Town to Downtown, the beaches, and other great areas. Unfortunately for Best Western on Mission Bay, location is important in San Diego and that is where this hotel is lacking. But since the price is right, it's still a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the room was average, but not what I expected for a "Best Western." The worst part of the hotel is really the location. The hotel is located in close proximity to attractions, but the neighborhood the hotel is in I found to be less than desirable. There is a 99 cent store and a car repair shop right by it. Overall, an ok place, but not somewhere I would reccommend staying for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from there after spending 6 nights. Was a little disappointed at first because it looks tired and isn't located in a nice, touristy area, but it was very clean. We ended up staying there and I was glad we did. It was very convenient to Int 5, so getting around was easy. We have 2 teenage boys so the continental breakfast saved us a little money and the refrigerator and microwave allowed us to buy snacks and keep restaurant leftovers. The pool and the hot tub were a little small but my guys didn't complain. The first night we had no AC, but once we reported it, management was very responsive and got a new unit to us the next morning. All in all I found the staff very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and the bed wasn't bad. If you're on a budget like we were, it's fine but doesn't have any frills.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and clean”
Reviews.Author: trane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in April, 2005 and found the Mission Bay Inn to be very good. It was easy to find for an Australian driving on the wrong side of the road!!!! We were given room 120 and found it to be very clean and easily accomodated our family of 4. The proximity of the Mission Bay Inn to Seaworld is a bonus. An easy 5 minute drive to Seaworld. We only had one breakfast here as the first morning we had breakfast with Shamu at Seaworld which I would highly recommend. ($15.00 all you can eat for 90 minutes with the whales) We did have breakfast the second morning and it was fresh and filling with juices, cereal, toast, donuts, muffins and tea/coffee. The reception staff were friendly. Yes, the motel has a pool in the parking lot but it looked O.K. The down side of this place was it was a bit noisy at night but the beds were comfortable and the rooms clean. I would recommend it to families. Also, if eating out try Troy's Family Restaurant at the shopping centre at the corner of Clairemont Drive and Clairemont Mesa Boulevard. We had the best meal for our whole trip at Troys and the staff were unbelievably friendly. I would stay again at the BW Mission Bay Inn.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for !!!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRuss
Reviews.Content: Reserved a king / non smoking room - requested top floor. When I got there, I got double queens on the first floor - right outside the vending machines. In addition the room (Room 117) smelled awful - like sewage or urine - unbearable. I went back to the front desk where I was told "sorry - no more rooms" Well, we were stuck for the night. The next morning, we decided that we would find another hotel to stay at. The one good thing is when we explained everything to the morning manager, she comped the room - so at least we didn't have to pay for the night. The carpet was wet within a 6 foot radius of the sink area - and the baseboards were rotted in that area, so it's been going on for a while. The continental breakfast was marginal at best. The swimming pool is in the middle of the parking lot. As my title says, you get what you pay for. Be careful with this one. If you are going to stay there, when you arrive, ask them to see the room first .. it might save you a lot of grief.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel For Budget Seekers Only !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Again, this hotel is for budget seekers only. What attracted us to this hotel was the fact that we could stay for only $65 a night and acourse the close proximity to Seaworld ! However, while making the reservation we requested a non-smoking room. We supposedly got one but it reeked of smoke. But staff swore up and down that it was a non-smoking room. Nonetheless, they offered no remorse and didn't offer us to switch rooms. The pool and jacuzzi are right in the middle of the parking lot. We came back from a daytrip to LA and wanted to enjoy the spa. However, it was closed and maybe we did feel entitled since we got stiffed on the room but we asked if we could enjoy the spa for about 30 minutes and staff replied no. Oh well :-) I forget the gentleman's name at the desk but he was the highlight of our stay. He was very helpful, patient and gave good driving directions. However, I would not stay at this hotel again nor will I recommend this place to anyone else. The funny thing is, I could have stayed at Doubletree for only $35 more a night !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel a couple of times. As a single woman, I was nervous the first time because the price was so good compared to other hotels in San Diego. I wondered what I was getting myself into. I was pleasantly surprised when I found a clean, conveniently located hotel, with staff that were friendly and helpful. If you're looking for a resort, this ain't it. If you're looking for a decent place to sleep, I would recommend it. Yes, the pool is in the parking lot, but it was very clean, and yes, the continental breakfast was mediocre, but edible.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTourist
Reviews.Content: The interior of my room was very nice. However, I stayed with a group of people, and everyone seemed to have a different complaint. It seemed every room had a problem - broken toilets, smells, bugs, no batteries in the remote, etc. The security lock on two of the rooms were broken. Also, people from local businesses kept sliding flyers through the door jamb. Combined with the broken locks, this didn't give me a high sense of security. The exterior was not so nice, and the hot tub and pool were in the middle of the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October 2003. I must admit I was a bit sceptical after reading the last review about the "insect problem". However we were pleasantly surprised! Our room was very clean and was cleaned every day and we were also supplied with fresh towels on a daily basis. The complimentary breakfast was enjoyable, a range of cereals and a choice of muffins and donuts etc and fruit!! We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, especially Susan on reception.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: TETravels
Reviews.Content: The room seemed fine initially, but that night the bathroom became home to dozens of ants and flies. When I explained the problem to the front desk person, including the entry point we found, he just wrote down "ants" and our room number on a form. He didn't offer any other comment, apologize or even seem concerned.
